Class IntervalsActivity

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class IntervalsActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
    The interval activity plays an interval and asks the user to identify it. The score is based on the number of consecutive correct answers.
    Author:
    Joshua Yuan

        public IntervalsActivity()

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initializes the Button fields and begins the test.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity

      • onPause

        protected void onPause()
        Stops any currently playing sounds when the user exits the activity.
        Overrides:
        onPause in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the internal player engine has not been initialized or has been released.

      • initializeButtons

        private void initializeButtons()
        Loads all the Button fields.

      • setAnswer

        private void setAnswer()
        Generates a new random interval and stores it in answer1 and answer2. Chances: 10% tritone, 30% perfect, 30% major, 30% minor. Method is invoked only when the last answer provided is correct.

      • playAnswer

        private void playAnswer()
        Plays the interval specified by answer1 and answer2. When playing a new interval, the starting note is pseudo-randomly picked.

      • testUser

        private void testUser()
        If the last answer was correct, this method plays a newly-generated interval. If the last answer was incorrect, this method replays the last interval.

      • reset

        private void reset()
        After a two second delay, this method disables the first row and starts a new test.

      • setBottomRowsEnabled

        private void setBottomRowsEnabled(boolean perfect,
                                  boolean other)
        Enables or disables the bottom two rows of buttons.
        Parameters:
        perfect - Controls the unison, fourth, fifth, and octave buttons.
        other - Controls the second, third, sixth, and seventh buttons.

      • setFirstRowEnabled

        private void setFirstRowEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the first row of buttons.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Controls the perfect, major, minor, and tritone buttons.

      • displayResult

        private void displayResult()
        Displays the result of the user's input as "Correct!" or "Try Again!". The score is either incremented (if correct) or reset to zero (if incorrect).

      • setHighScores

        private void setHighScores(int score)
        If the current score is higher than the high score, the new high score is updated in shared preferences.
        Parameters:
        score - The current score.

      • replayInterval

        public void replayInterval(android.view.View view)
        Replays the last interval for the user.
        Parameters:
        view - The REPLAY button pressed.

      • part1Clicked

        public void part1Clicked(android.view.View view)
        Sets the value of part1 after the user has selected perfect, major, or minor.
        Parameters:
        view - The button clicked by the user: perfect, major, or minor.

      • part2Clicked

        public void part2Clicked(android.view.View view)
        Sets the value of part2 after the user has selected an interval. The result is displayed, and the activity is reset.
        Parameters:
        view - The button clicked by the user: unison, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, octave, or tritone.
